title: The Ultimate List of Gaming & Tech Companies That Sponsor Small Streamers
excerpt: Ready to level up your stream? Our 2025 guide lists the top gaming hardware, software, and tech companies that actively sponsor small Twitch and YouTube streamers. Land your first deal.
content:
Turn Your Passion for Gaming into a Profession

For small streamers, landing that first sponsorship is a game-changer. It validates your hard work and provides the resources to improve your content. But the world of gaming and tech sponsorships can feel like a closed-off world. The good news? Many top companies have affiliate and sponsorship programs specifically for emerging creators. This list covers the brands actively looking to partner with streamers like you in 2025. For a complete step-by-step guide on how to get gaming sponsorships, including building a sponsorship deck and crafting the perfect pitch, check out our comprehensive 2026 guide.

Pitch Your Dream Sponsorship

Don't just apply. Post a unique content idea—like a dedicated stream or a hardware review video—on Newcollab and have tech brands bid on your project.

List Your Idea for Bids

Top Companies Sponsoring Small Streamers

From peripherals to energy drinks, these brands are known for supporting the grassroots gaming community.

  1. Logitech G: A giant in gaming peripherals (mice, keyboards, headsets). Their affiliate program is a great starting point.
  2. Razer: Known for high-performance gaming hardware. They have a popular affiliate program and frequently partner with streamers.
  3. Corsair: Offers everything from PC components to streaming gear like the Elgato line. A must-have partner for serious streamers.
  4. HyperX: Famous for their comfortable and high-quality gaming headsets. They have a structured affiliate program.
  5. Secretlab: The leading name in gaming chairs. Their affiliate program is very popular among streamers.
  6. SteelSeries: Another top contender in gaming peripherals, especially known for their mice and headsets.
  7. GFUEL: The most recognizable energy drink brand in the gaming space. They have a massive network of creator partners.
  8. NordVPN: A tech brand that heavily invests in the gaming community, sponsoring creators to promote online security.
  9. Epic Games (Support-A-Creator): While not a direct sponsorship, their Support-A-Creator program allows you to earn money when fans make purchases.
  10. Humble Bundle: A digital storefront for games that runs a popular partner program for creators to earn commissions.

"I was just an affiliate for a few brands. On Newcollab, I pitched a 'Building My Dream PC' series and Corsair sponsored three of the videos. It was a huge step up."

- Alex T., Tech Streamer

How to Approach These Brands

Most of these brands have a dedicated 'Affiliates' or 'Partnerships' page on their website. Start there. For a direct sponsorship, you'll need a professional media kit that highlights your Concurrent Viewers (CCV), audience engagement, and stream schedule. Show them you run a consistent and professional broadcast.

Conclusion: Level Up Your Creator Career

Affiliate programs are the first step. True paid sponsorships are the next. Use this list to get your foot in the door, but to really accelerate your career, start thinking like a business. Post your best content ideas on Newcollab and let the biggest names in tech and gaming compete for a spot on your stream.

faq.question: What stats do gaming sponsors care about most?
faq.answer: Beyond followers, they care most about Average Concurrent Viewers (CCV), chat engagement, and stream consistency. A streamer with 50 loyal, engaged viewers is often more valuable than one with 5,000 passive followers.

faq.question: What is the difference between an affiliate and a sponsorship?
faq.answer: An affiliate program is commission-based; you earn a percentage when your audience makes a purchase using your link/code. A sponsorship is a direct payment (or free product) in exchange for specific promotional activities, like a dedicated video or a logo on your stream.

faq.question: Do I need a media kit for gaming sponsorships?
faq.answer: Yes, absolutely. A professional media kit shows you are serious. It should include your stream stats, audience demographics, past successes, and a clear list of what sponsorship packages you offer.
